info.name: Multi-Tenant NestJS API - Comprehensive Collection
info.description:
Complete API collection for the Multi-Tenant NestJS Starter with Google OAuth, Notifications, Monitoring, and all system endpoints. This collection includes comprehensive test scripts, environment variable management, and realistic examples for all API functionality.

## Features Covered:
- Complete Authentication flows (Basic + Google OAuth)
- Tenant Management with Google SSO settings
- User, Role, and Permission Management
- Project Management
- Comprehensive Notification System
- Health Checks and System Monitoring
- Proper tenant isolation and security

## Usage:
1. Set up your environment variables (baseUrl, etc.)
2. Start with tenant registration or use existing tenant
3. Authenticate to get access token
4. Use any endpoint with proper authentication

## Environment Variables:
All necessary variables are automatically captured during API interactions.

pm.test('Response does not leak sensitive information', function () {

variable.description: Base URL for the API (development: http://localhost:3000/api, production: update as needed)
Current tenant identifier - automatically captured during tenant registration or login
JWT authentication token - automatically captured during login
Current user ID - automatically captured during user operations
Role ID for testing role operations - automatically captured during role creation
Permission ID for testing permission operations - automatically captured during permission creation
Project ID for testing project operations - automatically captured during project creation
Notification ID for testing notification operations - automatically captured during notification creation
Google OAuth authorization URL - automatically captured during OAuth initiation
Google OAuth state parameter - automatically captured during OAuth flow
Google OAuth authorization code - manually set from OAuth callback
JWT refresh token - automatically captured when available
Admin user ID for testing admin operations - automatically captured during tenant registration
Test email address for user operations
Google OAuth URL for account linking - automatically captured during linking initiation
Google OAuth state for account linking - automatically captured during linking initiation
Google OAuth authorization code for linking - manually set from OAuth callback

item.name: üîê Authentication
item.description: Complete authentication flows including basic auth and Google OAuth integration

item.name: Basic Auth
item.description: Standard email/password authentication endpoints

header.description: Tenant identifier - required for all authentication requests

request.description:
Authenticate a user with email and password. Returns a JWT access token that will be automatically captured for subsequent requests.

**Required Headers:**
- `x-tenant-id`: Tenant identifier
- `Content-Type`: application/json

**Request Body:**
- `email`: User's email address
- `password`: User's password

**Response:**
- `accessToken`: JWT token for authenticated requests

**Rate Limiting:** 5 requests per minute

**Example Scenarios:**
- Valid credentials: Returns 200 with access token
- Invalid credentials: Returns 401 Unauthorized
- Missing tenant ID: Returns 400 Bad Request
- Rate limit exceeded: Returns 429 Too Many Requests

exec: pm.test('Login request returns successful status', function () {
pm.test('Response content type is JSON', function () {
// Capture access token for subsequent requests
console.log('‚úÖ Access token captured and stored');
// Capture user ID if present in response

console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: tenantId not set. Please set a tenant ID first.');
console.log('üí° Tip: Register a tenant first or set tenantId manually');

**Validation Coverage:**

**Use Case:** Complete authentication system validation and security testing

item.name: Google OAuth Flow
item.description: Google OAuth 2.0 authentication flow endpoints

header.description: Tenant identifier - required to verify Google SSO is enabled

request.description:
Initiates Google OAuth authentication flow. Returns authorization URL and state parameter for CSRF protection.

**Required Headers:**
- `x-tenant-id`: Tenant identifier

**Response:**
- `authUrl`: Google OAuth authorization URL
- `state`: CSRF protection state parameter

**Rate Limiting:** 10 requests per minute

**Prerequisites:**
- Tenant must have Google SSO enabled
- Valid tenant ID must be provided

**Next Steps:**
1. Copy the `authUrl` from response
2. Open URL in browser to authenticate with Google
3. After Google authentication, copy the `code` parameter from callback URL
4. Use the `code` and `state` in the callback endpoint

**Example Flow:**
1. GET /auth/google ‚Üí Returns authUrl and state
2. User visits authUrl in browser
3. User authenticates with Google
4. Google redirects to callback with code
5. POST /auth/google/callback with code and state

exec: // Test script for Google OAuth initiation
pm.test('OAuth initiation returns successful status', function () {
console.log('‚úÖ Google OAuth URL and state captured');
console.log('üìã NEXT STEPS FOR GOOGLE OAUTH:');
console.log('1. Copy this URL and open in browser:');
console.log('3. Copy the "code" parameter from the callback URL');
console.log('4. Set the googleCode variable with that value');
console.log('5. Run the "Complete Google OAuth" request');
// Pre-request script for Google OAuth initiation
console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: tenantId not set. Google OAuth requires a valid tenant.');
console.log('üí° Tip: Register a tenant first or set tenantId manually');
console.log('üîê Initiating Google OAuth flow for tenant:', tenantId);

request.description:
Completes Google OAuth authentication flow. Exchanges authorization code for JWT token.

**Required Body Parameters:**
- `code`: Authorization code from Google OAuth callback
- `state`: State parameter from OAuth initiation (for CSRF protection)
- `tenantId`: Tenant identifier

**Response:**
- `accessToken`: JWT token for authenticated requests

**Rate Limiting:** 10 requests per minute

**Prerequisites:**
1. Must have initiated OAuth flow with GET /auth/google
2. Must have completed Google authentication in browser
3. Must have valid authorization code from Google

**Manual Setup Required:**
- Set `googleCode` variable with the authorization code from Google's callback URL
- The `state` and `tenantId` are automatically populated from previous requests

**Error Scenarios:**
- Invalid/expired state: 400 Bad Request
- Invalid authorization code: 401 Unauthorized
- Google SSO disabled: 403 Forbidden
- User not allowed in tenant: 403 Forbidden

exec: // Test script for Google OAuth callback
pm.test('OAuth callback returns successful status', function () {
// Capture access token for subsequent requests
console.log('‚úÖ Google OAuth access token captured and stored');
console.log('‚ùå Bad request - Check state parameter and authorization code');
console.log('‚ùå Unauthorized - Invalid authorization code or expired state');
console.log('‚ùå Forbidden - Google SSO disabled or user not allowed');
// Pre-request script for Google OAuth callback
console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: googleCode not set. You need to:');
console.log('3. Set googleCode variable from callback URL');
console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: googleState not set. Run "Initiate Google OAuth" first.');
console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: tenantId not set. Set tenant ID first.');

item.name: Account Linking
item.description: Link and unlink Google accounts with existing users

request.description:
Initiates Google account linking flow for authenticated users. Returns authorization URL and state parameter.

**Authentication Required:** Yes (Bearer token)

**Response:**
- `authUrl`: Google OAuth authorization URL for linking
- `state`: CSRF protection state parameter (includes user ID)

**Rate Limiting:** 5 requests per minute

**Prerequisites:**
- User must be authenticated (valid access token)
- User must not already have Google account linked

**Use Cases:**
- Link Google account to existing password-based account
- Add Google as additional authentication method
- Enable Google SSO for existing users

**Next Steps:**
1. Copy the `authUrl` from response
2. Open URL in browser to authenticate with Google
3. After Google authentication, copy the `code` parameter from callback URL
4. Use the `code` and `state` in the link callback endpoint

exec: // Test script for Google account linking initiation
pm.test('Account linking initiation returns successful status', function () {
console.log('‚úÖ Google linking URL and state captured');
console.log('üìã NEXT STEPS FOR GOOGLE ACCOUNT LINKING:');
console.log('1. Copy this URL and open in browser:');
console.log('3. Copy the "code" parameter from the callback URL');
console.log('4. Set the googleLinkCode variable with that value');
console.log('5. Run the "Complete Google Account Linking" request');
// Pre-request script for Google account linking
console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: No access token found. Please login first.');
console.log('üîó Initiating Google account linking for authenticated user');

request.description:
Completes Google account linking flow. Links Google account to authenticated user.

**Authentication Required:** Yes (Bearer token)

**Required Body Parameters:**
- `code`: Authorization code from Google OAuth callback
- `state`: State parameter from linking initiation (includes user ID)

**Response:**
- `message`: Success confirmation message

**Rate Limiting:** 5 requests per minute

**Prerequisites:**
1. Must be authenticated with valid access token
2. Must have initiated linking flow with GET /auth/google/link
3. Must have completed Google authentication in browser
4. Must have valid authorization code from Google

**Manual Setup Required:**
- Set `googleLinkCode` variable with the authorization code from Google's callback URL
- The `state` is automatically populated from the linking initiation request

**Validation Rules:**
- Google email must match user's current email
- Google account must not be linked to another user
- State parameter must be valid and include correct user ID

**Error Scenarios:**
- Email mismatch: 400 Bad Request
- Google account already linked: 409 Conflict
- Invalid state: 400 Bad Request
- Invalid authorization code: 401 Unauthorized

exec: // Test script for Google account linking completion
pm.test('Account linking returns successful status', function () {
console.log('üîó Google account linking completed successfully');
console.log('‚ùå Bad request - Check email match and state parameter');
console.log('‚ùå Conflict - Google account already linked to another user');
console.log('‚ùå Unauthorized - Invalid authorization code or state');
// Pre-request script for Google account linking completion
console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: No access token found. Please login first.');
console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: googleLinkCode not set. You need to:');
console.log('1. Run "Initiate Google Account Linking" first');
console.log('3. Set googleLinkCode variable from callback URL');
console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: googleLinkState not set. Run linking initiation first.');
console.log('üîó Completing Google account linking with:', {

request.description:
Unlinks Google account from authenticated user. Requires at least one other authentication method.

**Authentication Required:** Yes (Bearer token)

**Response:**
- `message`: Success confirmation message

**Rate Limiting:** 5 requests per minute

**Prerequisites:**
- User must be authenticated with valid access token
- User must have Google account linked
- User must have at least one other authentication method (password)

**Security Rules:**
- Cannot unlink if it's the only authentication method
- User must maintain at least one way to authenticate

**Use Cases:**
- Remove Google authentication method
- Security cleanup when changing authentication preferences
- Account security management

**Error Scenarios:**
- Google account not linked: 404 Not Found
- Only authentication method: 400 Bad Request
- Not authenticated: 401 Unauthorized

exec: // Test script for Google account unlinking
pm.test('Account unlinking returns successful status', function () {
console.log('‚ùå Bad request - Cannot unlink only authentication method');
console.log('‚ùå Not found - Google account not linked to this user');
// Pre-request script for Google account unlinking
console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: No access token found. Please login first.');
console.log('üîì Unlinking Google account for authenticated user');

item.name: Auth Management
item.description: Manage authentication methods and user auth status

request.description:
Returns the available authentication methods for the authenticated user.

**Authentication Required:** Yes (Bearer token)

**Response:**
- `authMethods`: Array of available authentication methods

**Possible Authentication Methods:**
- `password`: Email/password authentication
- `google`: Google OAuth authentication

**Use Cases:**
- Check which authentication methods are available
- Determine if user can unlink Google account
- Display authentication options in UI
- Security audit of user authentication methods

**Example Response:**
```json
{
  "authMethods": ["password", "google"]
}
```

**Security Notes:**
- Users must have at least one authentication method
- This endpoint helps prevent users from removing their only auth method

exec: // Test script for authentication methods endpoint
pm.test('Auth methods request returns successful status', function () {
pm.test('Response contains auth methods array', function () {
pm.test('Auth methods array is not empty', function () {
pm.test('Auth methods contain valid values', function () {
// Check if user can safely unlink Google
console.log('‚úÖ User can safely unlink Google account (has other auth methods)');
console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è User cannot unlink Google account (only auth method)');
console.log('‚ùå Not found - User not found');
console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: No access token found. Please login first.');
console.log('üîç Retrieving authentication methods for current user');
